verses.verse: מַה־ <S%H4100><s%> mah- How יָּפ֧וּ <S%H3303><s%> ya-Fu beautiful פְעָמַ֛יִךְ <S%H6471><s%> fe-'a-Ma-yich are thy feet בַּנְּעָלִ֖ים <S%H5275><s%> ban-ne-'a-Lim with shoes בַּת־ <S%H1323><s%> bat- daughter נָדִ֑יב <S%H5081><s%> na-Div; O prince's חַמּוּקֵ֣י <S%H2542><s%> cham-mu-Kei the joints יְרֵכַ֔יִךְ <S%H3409><s%> ye-re-Cha-yich, of thy thighs כְּמ֣וֹ <S%H3644><s%> ke-Mo are like חֲלָאִ֔ים <S%H2481><s%> cha-la-'Im, [are] like jewels מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה <S%H4639><s%> ma-'a-Seh the work יְדֵ֥י <S%H3027><s%> ye-Dei of the hands אָמָּֽן׃ <S%H542><s%> 'am-Man. of a cunning workman

שָׁרְרֵךְ֙ <S%H8326><s%> sha-re-reCh Thy navel אַגַּ֣ן <S%H101><s%> 'ag-Gan goblet הַסַּ֔הַר <S%H5469><s%> has-Sa-har, [is like] a round אַל־ <S%H408><s%> 'al- never יֶחְסַ֖ר <S%H2637><s%> yech-Sar [which] wanteth הַמָּ֑זֶג <S%H4197><s%> ham-Ma-zeg; not liquor בִּטְנֵךְ֙ <S%H990><s%> bit-neCh thy belly עֲרֵמַ֣ת <S%H6194><s%> 'a-re-Mat [is like] an heap חִטִּ֔ים <S%H2406><s%> chit-Tim, of wheat סוּגָ֖ה <S%H5473><s%> su-Gah set about בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃ <S%H7799><s%> bash-sho-shan-Nim. with lilies

שְׁנֵ֥י <S%H8147><s%> she-Nei Thy two שָׁדַ֛יִךְ <S%H7699><s%> sha-Da-yich breasts כִּשְׁנֵ֥י <S%H8147><s%> kish-Nei [are] like two עֳפָרִ֖ים <S%H6082><s%> 'o-fa-Rim young תָּאֳמֵ֥י <S%H8380><s%> to-'o-Mei [that are] twins צְבִיָּֽה׃ <S%H6646><s%> tze-vi-Yah. roes

צַוָּארֵ֖ךְ <S%H6677><s%> tzav-va-Rech Thy neck כְּמִגְדַּ֣ל <S%H4026><s%> ke-mig-Dal [is] as a tower הַשֵּׁ֑ן <S%H8127><s%> hash-Shen; of ivory עֵינַ֜יִךְ <S%H5869><s%> 'ei-Na-yich thine eyes בְּרֵכ֣וֹת <S%H1295><s%> be-re-Chot [like] the fishpools בְּחֶשְׁבּ֗וֹן <S%H2809><s%> be-chesh-Bon, in Heshbon עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- By שַׁ֙עַר֙ <S%H8179><s%> sha-'ar by the gate בַּת־ bat- רַבִּ֔ים <S%H1337><s%> rab-Bim, of Bathrabbim אַפֵּךְ֙ <S%H639><s%> 'ap-peCh thy nose כְּמִגְדַּ֣ל <S%H4026><s%> ke-mig-Dal [is] as the tower הַלְּבָנ֔וֹן <S%H3844><s%> hal-le-va-Non, of Lebanon צוֹפֶ֖ה <S%H6822><s%> tzo-Peh which looketh פְּנֵ֥י <S%H6440><s%> pe-Nei toward דַמָּֽשֶׂק׃ <S%H1834><s%> dam-Ma-sek. Damascus

רֹאשֵׁ֤ךְ <S%H7218><s%> ro-Shech Thine head עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ <S%H5921><s%> 'a-La-yich crowns כַּכַּרְמֶ֔ל <S%H3760><s%> kak-kar-Mel, upon thee [is] like Carmel וְדַלַּ֥ת <S%H1803><s%> ve-dal-Lat and the hair רֹאשֵׁ֖ךְ <S%H7218><s%> ro-Shech of thine head כָּאַרְגָּמָ֑ן <S%H713><s%> ka-'ar-ga-Man; like purple מֶ֖לֶךְ <S%H4428><s%> Me-lech the king אָס֥וּר <S%H631><s%> 'a-Sur [is] held בָּרְהָטִֽים׃ <S%H7298><s%> ba-re-ha-Tim. in the galleries

מַה־ <S%H4100><s%> mah- How יָּפִית֙ <S%H3302><s%> ya-Fit How fair וּמַה־ <S%H4100><s%> u-mah- and how נָּעַ֔מְתְּ <S%H5276><s%> na-'Amt, and how pleasant אַהֲבָ֖ה <S%H160><s%> 'a-ha-Vah art thou O love בַּתַּֽעֲנוּגִֽים׃ <S%H8588><s%> bat-Ta-'a-nu-Gim. for delights

זֹ֤את <S%H2063><s%> zot likewise קֽוֹמָתֵךְ֙ <S%H6967><s%> ko-ma-teCh This thy stature דָּֽמְתָ֣ה <S%H1819><s%> da-me-Tah is like לְתָמָ֔ר <S%H8558><s%> le-ta-Mar, to a palm tree וְשָׁדַ֖יִךְ <S%H7699><s%> ve-sha-Da-yich and thy breasts לְאַשְׁכֹּלֽוֹת׃ <S%H811><s%> le-'ash-ko-Lot. to clusters

אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ <S%H559><s%> 'a-Mar-ti I said אֶעֱלֶ֣ה <S%H5927><s%> 'e-'e-Leh I will go up בְתָמָ֔ר <S%H8558><s%> ve-ta-Mar, to the palm tree אֹֽחֲזָ֖ה <S%H270><s%> 'o-cha-Zah I will take hold בְּסַנְסִנָּ֑יו <S%H5577><s%> be-san-sin-Nav; of the boughs וְיִֽהְיוּ־ <S%H1961><s%> ve-yih-yu- become נָ֤א <S%H4994><s%> na may שָׁדַ֙יִךְ֙ <S%H7699><s%> sha-Da-yich thereof now also thy breasts כְּאֶשְׁכְּל֣וֹת <S%H811><s%> ke-'esh-ke-Lot shall be as clusters הַגֶּ֔פֶן <S%H1612><s%> hag-Ge-fen, of the vine וְרֵ֥יחַ <S%H7381><s%> ve-Rei-ach and the smell אַפֵּ֖ךְ <S%H639><s%> 'ap-Pech of thy nose כַּתַּפּוּחִֽים׃ <S%H8598><s%> kat-tap-pu-Chim. like apples

וְחִכֵּ֕ךְ <S%H2441><s%> ve-chik-Kech And the roof of thy mouth כְּיֵ֥ין <S%H3196><s%> ke-Yein wine הַטּ֛וֹב <S%H2896><s%> hat-Tov like the best הוֹלֵ֥ךְ <S%H1980><s%> ho-Lech that goeth לְדוֹדִ֖י <S%H1730><s%> le-do-Di for my beloved לְמֵישָׁרִ֑ים <S%H4339><s%> le-mei-sha-Rim; [down] sweetly דּוֹבֵ֖ב <S%H1680><s%> do-Vev to speak שִׂפְתֵ֥י <S%H8193><s%> sif-Tei causing the lips יְשֵׁנִֽים׃ <S%H3462><s%> ye-she-Nim. grow old
אֲנִ֣י <S%H589><s%> 'a-Ni I am לְדוֹדִ֔י <S%H1730><s%> le-do-Di, I [am] my beloved's וְעָלַ֖י <S%H5921><s%> ve-'a-Lai and תְּשׁוּקָתֽוֹ׃ <S%H8669><s%> te-shu-ka-To. and his desire ס sa-Mek

לְכָ֤ה <S%H1980><s%> le-Chah Come דוֹדִי֙ <S%H1730><s%> do-Di my beloved נֵצֵ֣א <S%H3318><s%> ne-Tze let us go forth הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה <S%H7704><s%> has-sa-Deh, into the field נָלִ֖ינָה <S%H3885><s%> na-Li-nah let us lodge בַּכְּפָרִֽים׃ <S%H3723><s%> bak-ke-fa-Rim. in the villages

נַשְׁכִּ֙ימָה֙ <S%H7925><s%> nash-Ki-mah Let us get up early לַכְּרָמִ֔ים <S%H3754><s%> lak-ke-ra-Mim, to the vineyards נִרְאֶ֞ה <S%H7200><s%> nir-'Eh let us see אִם <S%H518><s%> 'im whether פָּֽרְחָ֤ה <S%H6524><s%> pa-re-Chah flourish הַגֶּ֙פֶן֙ <S%H1612><s%> hag-Ge-fen if the vine פִּתַּ֣ח <S%H6605><s%> pit-Tach appear הַסְּמָדַ֔ר <S%H5563><s%> has-se-ma-Dar, [whether] the tender grape הֵנֵ֖צוּ <S%H5132><s%> he-Ne-tzu bud forth הָרִמּוֹנִ֑ים <S%H7416><s%> ha-rim-mo-Nim; [and] the pomegranates שָׁ֛ם <S%H8033><s%> sham There אֶתֵּ֥ן <S%H5414><s%> 'et-Ten there will I give אֶת־ <S%H853><s%> 'et- דֹּדַ֖י <S%H1730><s%> do-Dai thee my loves

לָֽךְ׃ Lach. הַֽדּוּדָאִ֣ים <S%H1736><s%> had-du-da-'Im The mandrakes נָֽתְנוּ־ <S%H5414><s%> na-te-nu- give רֵ֗יחַ <S%H7381><s%> Rei-ach, a smell וְעַל־ <S%H5921><s%> ve-'al- and over פְּתָחֵ֙ינוּ֙ <S%H6607><s%> pe-ta-Chei-nu and at our gates כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- are all מְגָדִ֔ים <S%H4022><s%> me-ga-Dim, [are] all manner of pleasant חֲדָשִׁ֖ים <S%H2319><s%> cha-da-Shim [fruits] new גַּם־ <S%H1571><s%> gam- again יְשָׁנִ֑ים <S%H3465><s%> ye-sha-Nim; and old דּוֹדִ֖י <S%H1730><s%> do-Di for thee O my beloved צָפַ֥נְתִּי <S%H6845><s%> tza-Fan-ti [which] I have laid up לָֽךְ׃ Lach.
